dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 965 RH: Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park Redesignation Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire (for herself and Ms. Shea-Porter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 7, 2017

form.official-title: To redesignate the Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site as the Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park Redesignation Act.

section.header: Designation of Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park

subsection.text: The Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site shall be known and designated as the Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park.

paragraph.text: by striking National Historic Site each place it appears and inserting National Historical Park;
in section 2(a), by striking historic site and inserting Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park;

subparagraph.text: striking national historical site and inserting Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park; and
striking part of the site and inserting part of the park; and

paragraph.text: in section 4(b), by striking traditional to the site and inserting traditional to the park.

subsection.text: Any reference in any law, regulation, document, record, map, or other paper of the United States to the Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site shall be considered to be a reference to the Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
